citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A female Cavalier King Charles Spaniel (Lynn's GIngersnap, m/c # 900217000511808) was very thin. The backbone was
easily seen and palpated. The ribs, shoulders and hips were also easily palpated. This dog is nursing three 4 week old
puppies. The dog has been dewormed and is being fed puppy food, however, she is still very thin. Thin body condition
can be the result of parasites, inadequate nutrition, or an underlying medical condition. This dog must be evaluated by a
veterinarian within 3 days of this inspection, to know with certainty the problem and the correct treatment. Documentation
of the evaluation, recommended treatment and delivered treatments must be available to APHIS officials.
Each dealer or exhibitor shall establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include the use of
appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. The owner must develop a better
method to identify and prevent weight loss in nursing females.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
End Section

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Direct Repeat
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A female Cavalier King Charles Spaniel (Lynn's GIngersnap, m/c # 900217000511808) was very thin. The backbone was 
easily seen and palpated. The ribs, shoulders and hips were also easily palpated. This dog is nursing three 4 week old 
puppies. The dog has been dewormed and is being fed puppy food, however, she is still very thin. Thin body condition 
can be the result of parasites, inadequate nutrition, or an underlying medical condition. This dog must be evaluated by a 
veterinarian within 3 days of this inspection, to know with certainty the problem and the correct treatment. Documentation 
of the evaluation, recommended treatment and delivered treatments must be available to APHIS officials.  
 
Each dealer or exhibitor shall establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include the use of 
appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. The owner must develop a better 
method to identify and prevent weight loss in nursing females. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
End Section
